qas.question: What were walled quarters known as?
Who was forced into confinement in mellahs?
When did the confinement of Moroccan Jews in mellahs begin?
What dynasty did not massacre Jews?
Where were Jews in Islamic Persia confined to?
Where were Jews confined after the 19th century?
What was conflated with anti-Zionist publications in historical times?
What Jewish movements have made antisemitic pronouncements?

context: Notable exceptions include the massacre of Jews and forcible conversion of some Jews by the rulers of the <b3_0>Almohad<b3_0/> dynasty in Al-Andalus in the 12th century, as well as in Islamic Persia, and the forced confinement of <a1_0>Moroccan Jews<a1_0/> to walled quarters known as <a0_0><b4_0><b5_0>mellahs<b5_0/><b4_0/><a0_0/> beginning from the <a2_0>15th century<a2_0/> and especially in the early 19th century. In modern times, it has become commonplace for standard <b6_0>antisemitic themes<b6_0/> to be conflated with anti-Zionist publications and pronouncements of Islamic movements such as <b7_0>Hezbollah<b7_0/> and Hamas, in the pronouncements of various agencies of the Islamic Republic of Iran, and even in the newspapers and other publications of Turkish Refah Partisi."
